title: Someone was playing on my account?
body: So, I stopped playing League for a while and someone has clearly hacked into my account. I noticed because theres matches been played in the last 2 dayss and I have a whole lot of new 'chinese' friends/

replies.body:
So this just happened to me today also... how is it possible?
I changed my password and have control of my account back, is that good enough?
I have 7 banned accounts and can tell you now , the "someones been on my account" excuse will not work.

As has been mentioned, it's definitely a good idea to perform a scan of your computer for any malicious software, just in case there's something there that would have given this "individual" a means to access your account. Also, it's worth submitting a ticket to Riot support about the compromise. At least that way, they're aware the account was compromised should the individual have performed any rule-breaking during their access. As always, it's best to provide as much information as you can.

As a note, if you use public computers it's always a good idea to check for suspicious programs running in the background using Task Manager and if there's any suspicious hardware attached to the computer itself, as these may indicate the use of key-loggers.

Report it asap

Same thing happened on my main account except I didn't notice as I was on hiatus and it got Permabanned and support won't reopen my account saying they are not responsible for the security of my account....
I've changed my password to regain access to my account. Should I take any other steps to ensure my account is safe? Also, fuck the guy who took my account.
